replies.bodyText: Statistics collection for that is enabled/disabled per map, this was the reason i did it like this. WDYT?
replies.author: ahmetmircik

replies.bodyText:
Ok, let's keep it here but maybe just change it to map.entryprocessor.offloadable.executor or change it even to map.offloadable.executor because:
• we have other prefixes that don't separate words with dots (e.g. nearcache)
• maybe we will use that executor for other tasks so we can remove mention of EP
replies.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Missing changes in ConfigXmlGenerator, ConfigXmlGeneratorTest and ConfigCompatibilityChecker, same for other config.
timeline.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Will this wrap the exception? Do we have tests for this case?
timeline.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Does the "execution time" include the queueing time in all of the uses of the executor stats?
timeline.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: No, it's meaning is aligned with executor service and it is the execution time in thread without queueing time.
replies.author: ahmetmircik

timeline.bodyText: Minor: I see none of the other names of the keys have With in them.
timeline.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Again, can this wrap the exception that was previously not wrapped?
timeline.author: mmedenjak

timeline.bodyText: Minor: I know that the default values for newly added booleans are false by default, hence statisticsEnabled can be used like this but I think it would be better if we don't rely on this fact and use something like parameters.isStatisticsEnabledExists && parameters.statisticsEnabled
timeline.author: mdumandag

replies.bodyText: Default value is true. But i wonder in what scenario client doesn't send statisticsEnabled to server?
replies.author: ahmetmircik

replies.bodyText:
isStatisticsEnabledExists will be false for old clients (v4.0 series)(statisticsEnabled will have the default value for its type in this case, but I think we shouldn't rely on this fact and consider statisticsEnabled as something undefined) and will be true otherwise. (>=v4.1). statisticsEnabled will only have a valid value when the isStatisticsEnabledExists is true.
So, if we want to also enable statistics when the v4.0 client adds an executor config, something like !parameters.isStatisticsEnabledExists || parameters.statisticsEnabled would be enough. I initially thought that we would disable statistics when the old client adds an executor config. If that is the case, the snippet in my first comment would work.
replies.author: mdumandag

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the explanation. It should have been fixed now.
replies.author: ahmetmircik

timeline.bodyText: Minor: Would it be better to rename those as scheduledExecutorStats and durableExecutorStats to be consistent with others?
timeline.author: mdumandag

timeline.bodyText: Minor: Maybe we could rename nearCacheDescriptor to something else?
timeline.author: mdumandag

timeline.bodyText: IMHO TODO's rarely get fixed (check out how many we already have). Either add the stats, or open a GH issue, or just conclude it's not worth the hassle and remove the TODO.
timeline.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: Removed TODO. I have learned cancellation is not supported for durable executor. Added this to TDD.
replies.author: ahmetmircik
